website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a nice, simple ultracompact for use indoors and out, you'll want to strongly consider the Canon PowerShot Elph 300 HS.
pros: The Canon PowerShot Elph 300 HS is a fun-to-use ultracompact with excellent photo quality even if just left in auto
cons: The 300 HS might be too small for some, and accessing its shooting modes other than auto is laborious

customer_reviews.title: I originally received this as a Birthday present in 2013 ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally received this as a Birthday present in 2013. I am writing a product review now after having time to use it on trips. The camera functioned well up until 1.5 years when the lens started malfunctioning and I couldn't zoom without the lens getting jammed and shutting the camera off. There was no fix for this so I had to toss the camera. I did research on this camera and found that a lot of people had this issue and they couldn't fix their cameras as well. The camera is cute and very convenient to carry around but not very hardy. Dust that gets trapped in the lens over time will end up ruining the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kp

customer_reviews.title: Slick design great camera / video camera .
customer_reviews.text: Love my cannon. Never owned a cannon before always wanted to. I am really pleased. It takes great video, but stops at about 10 miniutes. The vids are clear the pics are wonderful. For the price you really can't beat it. The little mic in the camera picks up great too for video on u-tube. Glad I found it and would highly recommend to another. Small light weight compact makes it nice to take where ever you want to go!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Cameron

customer_reviews.title: greatest camera phone current technology affords
customer_reviews.text: As most of us do I have the latest, greatest camera phone current technology affords. I also have a Canon PowerShot SX60 HS. Both great! Yet... my elph is my favorite. Unlike my camera phone, the Elph is not too simple as it gives me plenty of easy to use options to experiment with and produces a great photo. And unlike my SX60, my Elph isn't so sophisticated that I spend ton of time and energy dealing with focus, aperture, exposure and all those other things "professional" photographers love. When people gasp "what camera did you use to take THAT photo"? My answer is always my Canon Elph.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri

customer_reviews.title: Takes good pictures but I originally bought the camera for recording ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes good pictures but I originally bought the camera for recording videos. The video quality is wonderful, however the mic makes weird noises and I have no idea what it is. It is most likely due to the fact a bought a pre-owned camera, but I knew that was a gamble going in. If you can afford to, get this camera new and hopefully you won't have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Love my camera!
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for two years, still going strong! even through the hot humid climate where I live in SE Asia! Great in low light conditions, which I love, because picture quality is usually so much better without the flash needing to go off! Easy to carry around, so small and light. Just a tip about taking video - if you zoom in during filming, and sound quality is very important to you (like my sister's violin recital!) when you playback the video you will hear little clicking sounds given off by the little zoom motor. Most of the time I have no need to zoom during filming, however. So I'm keeping it at 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: VERY TINY CANERA 💖
customer_reviews.text: Loved how tiny it was. Great photo and video quality while outdoors on a sunny day but terrible on low or even indoor light. The zoom very limited. I was hoping to use this to take photos and video so I could save space on my Samsung phone but the phone ended up being much more superior.
customer_reviews.author: AngelRipper01

customer_reviews.title: Canon Elph 300 HS
customer_reviews.text: Bought at the time it was just coming out, and thinking I was upgrading from my Sony w290, and going to Canon, I had very high expectations. I remember the 'wow' factor was not there at first use. Now, over a year has passed and feel its a good camera. The performance in low light is very good and by far the best improvement I had over my last camera. But I see colors are a little more dull on this camera's photos than the ones my Sony produced (in daylight). The HD video looks great and you have the ability to zoom in/out. Overall this is a great camera and for the price now is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: HR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for shooting on the go
customer_reviews.text: Took this with me to California and I was able to get the feel of it relatively quick. The low-light setting was impressive and the features are easy to manipulate without fussing with a lot of menu options. Great idea with the sandpaper exterior - helps keep a tight hold on it. It's so small and compact that I'm sorry to say I've misplaced it...deciding whether or not to go with this again or the Canon PowerShot S95. For the price, this camera is a MUST-HAVE! Update: Found it! Phew. Still amazing pictures. Just be careful when using the Vivid mode - not everything looks great vivid.
customer_reviews.author: NEO_shopper

customer_reviews.title: The only pocket camera you'll need. Canon strikes again!
customer_reviews.text: This little camera is AWESOME.. You would never believe the quality of the photos that this camera takes. It really packs a punch. I don't know how Canon does it, but this thing takes EXCELLENT photos and not just for it's size, but in general. I upgraded to this model from the 780IS (Which also took great pictures, but was getting old) and it's been great. Edit: 3/20/15 Still a great camera. If you could pick a used one up for under $75 then DO IT! This is an amazing little camera.
customer_reviews.author: C. John Smith

customer_reviews.title: I love Canons
customer_reviews.text: I don't really have a good technical reason for why I love Canons, I just do. If you're looking for the technical comparison of this versus other cameras, go to cnet.com for the review. I like that this camera is so sleek, nice and sturdy feeling. I had a Canon for a while that I ended up breaking by dropping. The shutter stopped working. So, then I got a Sony, which is having problems with the controls. For some reason I never really got into the Sony, not that there was any wrong with it. I guess I just liked my first camera. So, I'm back and reunited with a newer and better version of my first love, the Canon.
customer_reviews.author: D. Feng

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot Elph 300
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for 3 years or so and love it. It is so light and easy to carry. I find it easier to use than my iphone for getting a lot of pictures--especially with zoom and overall picture quality. I've never had a mechanical problem. Once or twice the camera has said it "defected" an issue and shut down. But then has worked fine afterwards. Picture quality always good. Very happy and if it ever breaks I will buy one similar to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Austen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera several months ago - my decision influenced a great deal by the positive reviews, so thanks to the people who took the time to review it - and am extremely happy with it! The camera is very easy to use, takes incredible pictures, and the lithium battery has a long life between charges. The screen is easy to see in sunlight, and indoors, I can take many pictures without a flash, which gives them a more natural look. I also love the small size. I'm certainly not a professional, but do take a lot of pictures, and I would highly recommend this camera to anyone that wants a simple, compact, full-featured camera!!
customer_reviews.author: love the beach

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera so far!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the ELPH 300 HS to replace my Nikon S3100 which developed a "Lens Error" after only 3 months. So far I have been very happy with the Canon as it powers up quickly and takes pictures quickly as well. The only thing I liked better about the Nikon was the fit and finish. The black buttons are OK on the Canon, and everything functions just fine, the Nikon just looks sleeker. So far the picture quality is just as good, if not better than the Nikon. The camera is also the same size as the Nikon it replaced, so if fit nicely into the same compact case. Hopefully this one will last longer than 3 months!
customer_reviews.author: Ydtrack

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little camera!
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable camera when skiing, fly fishing, backpacking, and for all occasions. Got it just after it had come out. Excellent res photos & video. Ordered this to replace exact same one that we broke with a fall while bkpking (landed right on it)...coulda fixed but only a little more for a new one. Would buy again if we mess this one up. 12/22/13: Just had ? From someone about type of cards this uses. I always use sdhc, but it will also use: sd, sdhc, MultiMedia, MMC+, HC MMC+, & Eye-FI cards , per Getting Started' manual.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dale

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. Does what it says it would do!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to replace my Canon PowerShot SD400, which my husband now uses as his pocket camera. I have been pleasantly pleased with the way this camera performs in low light, though I am still sort of overwhelmed with all the options. I usually just leave it on manual, daytime. I don't like how large the screen is but I think it's just because I am so used to the size and the feel of the old camera....speaking of which, I *do* prefer the straight lines and boxiness of the older camera to the curved "cuteness" of this new one.
customer_reviews.author: C. Acey

customer_reviews.title: Really nice, takes great pictures, very good low light
customer_reviews.text: My friends thought it was silly to buy a camera when virtually all of our phones have cameras on them now. I put this side by side with my smartphone and the pictures on this camera are much nicer. My wife is the primary user and she loves it. We use it in low light areas quite a bit and it works very well. I don't use it much but when I do its easy for me to figure out how to do what I want on it. It is intuitive enough for me. It is deceptively small. We are very happy with this camera and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: BBQ Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: I got the red finish for about $150 (on sale) and I love it! You can't beat the price. This is a point and shoot camera for sure, but it is so compact to carry around. I have been capturing photos of my son around the house and took it to NY and DC. I usually carry a DSLR, but with my toddler, it is very hard to manage. This camera is easy to carry and easy to whip out. It takes fast, sharp pictures indoors and out. I am really pleased with the video function as well. I am still learning about it, but so far I would highly recommend it especially at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: crissibeth17Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It's a PowerShot
customer_reviews.text: From what I tested so far, it's a really decent device. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a decent, yet affordable point n shoot camera. Zoom is nice and I was able to catch moving actions with out motion blur. Though one down side is I notice it takes a second to snap after pressing the button. Might not bother some but it's harder to time that "just right" movement shot. I would recommend this for the average user / vacationer.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Unit
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many point-and-shoot digital cameras. I always have them on me and take lots of candid shots wherever we are. Generally speaking, these cameras last between a year and two for about 20,000 shutter clicks. This Canon was a little bit better than that. I am at 27 months and a little over 20,000 shots. Presently, the lens will not zoom. It still takes photographs. This camera is solidly-built. The menus are easy to maneuver. There are scenes, etc. I don't get too into all that, although the lighting options are good and make a difference. I am looking for a replacement for this camera but may just end up purchasing another one just like it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Owens

customer_reviews.title: A fine upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I like keeping my wife equipped with the tools she needs for her interests in life. She is a world class doll maker (On Etsy -- maineartisen). She needed to take pictures for posting her Waldorf dolls and the previous Canon had an articulated screen but less than stellar image quality. This camera changes that and it is so portable she can keep it on her person when she is out among her beloved Nigerian goats. As they say, the best camera is the one you have with you. Quality of this sort in this form factor is what progressive technology is all about. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor low light photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera as a replacement for a SD600 6 megapixel canon elph that was 6 years old. Taking photos outdoors and in good natural light were comparable to the old camera. photos taken indoors when the sun was beaming through the windows were yellow in color and not nearly as vibrant as the old camera. I tried experimenting with the settings for a little while then gave up because the "automatic" setting should work without having to read the manual (just like the old camera). In my opinion canon missed the mark with this camera. I've already returned it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Eide

customer_reviews.title: Not as good picture quality as older SD models.
customer_reviews.text: Received and returned Canon 300 HS which I bought hoping to improve on my Canon SD1200. The picture resolution was inferior to the SD1200 across the whole zoom range. My other, older SD450 was just as good in picture quality as the SD1200, if not better. Seems as the new models come out with more features like better video, more megapixels, more zoom, etc., the picture (lens?} quality deteriorates. If improved movies and wide angle zoom is important to someone, one may decide to settle for somewhat inferior pictures and buy this otherwise nice camera.
customer_reviews.author: GVK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: I have had 35MM SLRs, many digital cameras and camcorders. My current love is the Canon S90 and this Elph 300 HS (my wife's) takes photos that I cannot tell from the S90, even when magnifying with Lightroom. The small size and acceptable zoom makes it perfect for any pocket. I bought it for the low light casual photos and I am not disappointed. Have not used the video as I have other equipment for that. Highly recommend for $200 Like all these small Canons, make sure you have a fully charged battery or two.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast 46

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I did not get everything described from the descriptions I should’ve got in the box it was missing Wrist Strap, AV Cable, USB Interface Cable, Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM, Documentation and I got a spare battery that doesn’t work for the camera lastly the condition is poor
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon does it again!
customer_reviews.text: I strayed from Canon and now I'm back and will never leave again. I loved my first Canon Elph 10 years ago which was only a 2mp at the time (this one being a 12mp). I've gone on to the larger powershots but always said I missed my little elph. I love the texture of this one I'm not sure if it's just in the black model I got but it's a sandy rough texture. The camera takes amazing pics and I love all the little features. It's simple to use without even needing to go through the manual and takes amazing pictures!! Thanks Canon!
customer_reviews.author: D. gallogly

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!
customer_reviews.text: i GOT THIS CAMERA AS AN EARLY CHRISTMAS GIFT AND HAVE HAD IT FOR ABOUT THREE WEEKS NOW AND I LOVE IT! I STILL DISCOVER THINGS ON IT I DIDNT KNOW IT DID. THE DIFFERENT SHOOT STYLES IT HAS UNDER THE PROGRAM SELECTION ARE GREAT. YOU CAN TAKE ALL SORTS OF PICTURES, WE ARE USING ALL THE DIFFERENT STYLES TO MAKE UNIQUE PHOTOS AND GIVING THEM OUT FOR CHRISTMAS GIFTS TO THE PARENTS AND GRANDPARENTS! IT IS LIGHT WEIGHT AND EASY TO CARRY AROUND EVEN IF U ARE HOLDING A SMALL CLUTCH BAG (FOR THE LADIES). I RECOMEND THIS PRODUCT AND IT IS SO MUCH CHEAPER ON AMAZON THEN IN THE STORES.
customer_reviews.author: KLo

customer_reviews.title: Very Small and Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Amazon had a sale and I could not resist getting this camera. My previous pocket camera was a Canon A540 and I loved it for several years until I dropped it and it did not recover from the trauma. There isn't much I can add to what all others have said before me. So after owning dozens of cameras since the 1970s ranging from Minolta SLR film, then a few dSLR models, Bridge and a myriad of pocket cameras...I have enjoyed the Canon brand best. Everything is simple, intuitive, and my photos are very good (8.5/10). Not perfect, but still very good.
customer_reviews.author: Master_of_None

customer_reviews.title: great little camera
customer_reviews.text: The reviews on this site were helpful to me in choosing the Canon PowerShot Elph 300 to replace my old camera. So far, I'm very impressed. I use it a lot for business under not always ideal conditions. The picture and video quality even in low light is great. I ordered a couple of cheap replacement batteries so I always have a back up. It's tiny but powerful. I haven't explored all the bells and whistles yet but I didn't really need the manual to get started using it. The controls are pretty intuitive if you've had a digital camera before.
customer_reviews.author: Floridagal

customer_reviews.title: Nice features in an easy to take with you package
customer_reviews.text: This camera is easy to take along, as it is small and lightweight. The black finish is non-slip and looks nice. The video quality is very nice and you can zoom in and out while taking video (optical at least...I keep digital zoom turned off). Has quick to access scenes and has a dedicated video record button. Also starts up fairly quick to begin taking photos. My dad liked it too and bought one for himself. One con is that I couldn't just cable it up and begin viewing...software had to be installed. But a card drive is easy too and gets around that.
customer_reviews.author: ALB

customer_reviews.title: Fits in your back pocket
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a good digital camera that was compact enough to fit in my pocket or a purse pocket. This camera takes great pictures for what I want....capturing memories and sharing on social media. The zoom on it is really good, but if you are taking a far away picture with the zoom all the way out, the pic is going to look like such....meaning it will have a bit of haze. I'm not a camera or photo expert, and I think this is a great camera for anyone else who is looking for a compact camera for everyday pics.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Point & Shoot Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great pictures, is so handy to carry and I love the quality of finished pictures. There are so many menu options I highly recommend taking the time to read and learn about what it can do. If that's not your style, the auto mode works very well. I carry it in my purse so I have it everywhere. It does use the SDHC card which seems to be the new normal with the higher resolution cameras. Battery lasts very long between charges. I totally recommend this camera for novices or intermediate photographers that want something easy to carry around. Takes much better pictures than most smart phones.
customer_reviews.author: Workin' Mom

customer_reviews.title: Amazon warehouse defective camera
customer_reviews.text: Camera had a loud clicking during video autofocus. Not a little normal sound but an outright cant watch the video because it clicked so loud. Amazon warehouse should be ashamed to sell this defective camera and then have the nerve on a chat with tech support it is normal. Hello its not!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Another nice compact Canon
customer_reviews.text: Got this for the wife, we've had 2 previous Canon PowerShots SD300 and SD450, and they still work great! But we wanted to upgrade to this for the wide angle view, and this camera does it! Super wide angle to catch everything. At its widest, I see a slight fisheye effect that can be a bit annoying when taking photos of people, but landscape shooting, its awesome! We really wanted to get the S100, but it was too pricey so this one fits the build just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dawgs Fam

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Canon XSI that I never used and decided to down size. After many reviews and comparisons I decided to purchase this point and shoot. I do not regret this purchase whatsoever. I love the gritty texture of the body of the camera and the marco setting. The screen is a decent size, could be a bit bigger but it lets you zoom in on the photos so that is nice. It does not come with a memory card or adapter so make sure to purchase one otherwise you cannot save your photos.
customer_reviews.author: MarissaJohnston

customer_reviews.title: Better than the newer model 310HS
customer_reviews.text: After extensive searching for a low-priced point and shoot, I narrowed my search down to the Canon ELPH. I've had them in the past and they're great to use. You should go check out SnapSort (.com) and do a side-by-side comparison of this camera and the newer version, the 310HS. You should stick with this camera for the price, considering the newer model is actually lacking features. Go check out what the experts have to say. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: it was perfect
customer_reviews.text: i loved it . we got it for valentines day. it worked great. we took to the beaches of the caribbean. it worked great. one day i was waving to someone. i forgot it was on my wrist with the strap. it flew way high into the air. and landed on the concrete, and split open. i taped it back together with butterfly bandeges. performance is balky. i wimper all night long. we got another simliar one on ebay. it has a little spot on all the images. i wimper. all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Norman S. Stickney III

customer_reviews.title: Take beautiful pictures
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS camera for my mom. I have the same one and her and both love it. I love everything about this camera. It takes gorgeous crisp pictures. It is extremely user friendly. The price on here was expensive, but it was the only place I could find it. So I just ate the cost and purchased it here. I wish they still made this model.
customer_reviews.author: SumSum

customer_reviews.title: Just recieved my Cannon PowerShot ELPH 300
customer_reviews.text: I recieved my camera today and I was so happy with shipping & product that I had to rush here to write a review. The look and feel are awesome, the Picture quality and the video quality is amazing. The price makes this all the better! Ive only have about 5-6 poin and shoot cameras from nikon, sony, 3 kodaks (I love their cameras and software) but this time I wanted to try something else. I read some review and convinced that this was a good buy... it was! I dont think youll have any regret unless your a professional that is comparing their $1,000 picture quality camera to this.
customer_reviews.author: Twinkie354

customer_reviews.title: Failed after a few months
customer_reviews.text: The camera takes great pictures, and the video button on the back is a nice touch. Otherwise, it's pretty much like any other point-and-shoot. But after 7 months, the LCD display on the back just died completely, making the camera useless. I found a number of complaints on other sites about the LCD display dying like that. I've shipped it back to their repair department (the warranty process was quite easy) so we'll see if they get it repaired quickly and if the camera is reliable after that.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Canon does not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved the compact cameras from Canon, I own a SD 1000 which has gotten very old so I bought this as a replacement and it works perfectly for me, its obviously not as good as SLRs but it is much quicker than my old camera in terms of boot up and time between shots. A bonus for me is that I am able to continue using my old camera's battery charger as Canon has thankfully not changed its specs. I have used compact cameras from other manufacturers but imho Canon makes the best ones
customer_reviews.author: pcacsb

customer_reviews.title: Snazzy Quality Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I adore this camera and STILL use it on a regular basis. When I first purchased it, I received numerous compliments on the color --red -- which I had thought might be too flashy, but turned out to be quite elegant. This is a compact camera with excellent photo quality for a point-and-shoot, which is what I need when I'm on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera - Buy it Refurbished by the Manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these refurbished cameras for my 10 years old nephews. They had a blast taking thousands of pictures and making movies while visiting. Some pictures were printed 10 x 12 in and looked really great. I only use the top high end professional digital SLRs with professional lenses but I have to admit that this little camera does a great job and was sturdy... I have a tendency to consider that some items are better when refurbished because manufacturers must go through must stricter quality controls before they re-sell their items. And... if there was a weak part, it died and was replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno Lassus

customer_reviews.title: Can handle abuse somewhat.
customer_reviews.text: I've taken this around the world with me, through jungle, desert, freezing altitudes, through dusty colour runs, and numerous festivals and it has still survived albeit a bit worn from overuse. After a year of intensive usage, the zoom function on the lense has given way in manual mode but can still function somewhat in the auto setting. Most things aren't built to last these days but given the excess I've taken this Canon to, I am quite happy it can still take a decent picture.
customer_reviews.author: Jenius

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful product quality and excellent functionality in an amazingly small and very attractive package, all at an exceptionally low price considering. Picture quality is very good, surprisingly close to the Leica D-Lux 4 (Panasonic LX3) and the Olympus XZ 1 that I compared it against. The best and best value compact point and shoot on the market for sure. I haven't yet tried its full HD / stereo recording (one can use the zoom too), but reviews are glowing. Bravo, Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Noble

customer_reviews.title: canon elph300hs
customer_reviews.text: bought this camera for it's portability to take on a hiking/trout fishing trip to colorado. kept it in my pocket and had no problem with it's dependability and ruggedness. of course, i didn't drop it or abuse it either. took about 300 shots over 6 days during the trip, plus reviewing them, and never charged the battery. works great and the pictures look good. i hesitated buying this camera based on some of the other reviews but finally took a chance. didn't have any of the problems some of the other reviewers had, maybe i happen to get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: L-J6

customer_reviews.title: Nice Compact Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera so far and been everything I expected and more. The textured feel of the casing is quality and helps eliminate the camera from slipping out of the hands. The overall picture and HD video quality is very good for this category of cameras. The only thing that I would change with this camera is to have a higher resolution LCD which shows the true quality of the images that are taken. For a pocket point and shoot this camera is perfect and offers enough useful settings for making image adjustments based on personal needs and wants.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Lasts Long, Decent pictures
customer_reviews.text: Its not grade A stuff but its a Grade A price/performance value. My clumsy girlfriend drops this a lot, this things lived through icy hiking trips so its pretty tough, no problems with it so far in two years, battery life is still great lasts through a whole day of hiking and picture taking. Pictures are what you expect from cameras at this price, if your really technical about specs and every other nitpicky thing, you should just save your money for a Good SLR.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Q. Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera I have ever owned - being an average photographer. It is easy to use, I can upload pictures from the camera to my computer with ease; it takes sharp, clean pictures, and is excellent for carrying in my small purse! The only issue would be re-charging the batteries - seems to charge down in a shorter time than I would prefer. I have only had the camera for approx 2 months and have already charged it twice and I don't use it everyday. Other than that, it is GREAT, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: L R Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Great pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera to replace my old canon. I have had several point and shoot digicams over the years and this one is the best. Pictures are very good with the 12MP. It has lots of manual adjustment options which I dabble with, but the auto setting works great and is easy to get to. It has a nice metal case as well. It was easy to pick up and start using. I am by no means a professional, but it has given me great pictures and has lasted very well.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: I got this baby to replace my SD750.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I have no complaints, works fast, flash is great, low light pictures are amazing. Love the big screen in the back. The only thing I would really want is panorama. But I keep forgetting my iphone has it so eh I guess. It's a really really sick camera for everything from Macro to portraits. I love it. I didn't even have to buy a new battery because it fit the same one as my SD750. YAY!! Get it!
customer_reviews.author: lizzy2pink

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great quality photos.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Canan PowerShot Elph because I use them so much! Easy to use and great quality photos.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Floyd-Thaut

customer_reviews.title: Now have 2 of these
customer_reviews.text: I take this camera everywhere and use it several times a week. Most pictures are of sunset etc but I have also been happy with the videos that it takes. Price was right also. I like compact cameras and this is the best one thus far. Camera is meant for casual and basic use. Battery last a fair amount of time also before having to charge again. For special events, I make sure to bring the charger and it is also efficient with charge time. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Havedogwilltravel

customer_reviews.title: Very good slow motion mode

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with Full 1080p HD Video (Red)
product_meta.description:
Color:Red| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Canon 5097B001 PowerShot ELPH 300 HS Red 12MP Digital Camera with 5x Zoom and 2.7 In. LCD Display has a slim profile that will not only make you stand out from the crowd, but it will also deliver incredibly brilliant still images and amazing 1080p HD videos. Once you turn on the camera, be prepared to be amazed at how much is packed into one of the slimmest point-and-shoot digital cameras on the market. So let your imagination run free and let the HS SYSTEM, 24mm 5x Optical Zoom and 12.1 Megapixels help you achieve great images everywhere.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 

Don't let the PowerShot ELPH 300 HS digital camera's slim profile and good looks fool you. This slick little device may stand out from the crowd, but it'll also deliver brilliant still images, ultra-detailed 1080p Full HD video, serious functionality, and a wealth of effects and automatic settings. You'll be surprised how much is packed into such a slim point-and-shoot. Let your imagination run wild, and let Canon's HS SYSTEM, a 24mm lens, 5x Optical Zoom, and 12.1 Megapixels help you snap great photos everywhere.

The ELPH 300 HS is less than an inch deep and weighs less than 5 ounces. Ultra wide-angle 24mm lens and 5x optical zoom on board. Canon's HS SYSTEM improves shooting in low-light situations without the need for a flash, and lowers noise levels at higher ISO settings. INCREDIBLY THIN. INCREDIBLY POWERFUL.
THIN IS IN
At less than an inch deep and weighing just under five ounces, the PowerShot 300 HS will fit right in your pocket, but it packs plenty of power into its sleek point-and-shoot body. A 24mm ultra wide-angle lens with a powerful 5x optical zoom gives you the versatility to shoot in any number of situations, and the optical image stabilizer keeps things from getting too shaky when you're zoomed in tight. Whether you're out partying or just walking around town, you don't need to sacrifice style for power--the PowerShot ELPH 300 HS has got you covered for capturing great photos effortlessly.

NO MORE DARK PHOTOS
Canon's HS SYSTEM improves shooting in low-light situations without the need for a flash, and lowers noise levels at higher ISO settings.

The Canon HS SYSTEM takes the frustration out of low-light shooting, delivering clear, blur-free shots with all the ambiance intact, and freeing you from the sometimes unwanted effects of using the flash. Beautiful low-light shots are possible at both low and high ISO speeds, and the dynamic range is expanded to retain maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas.

The system is the result of two technologies brought together in this compact PowerShot. The first is the 12.1 Megapixel CMOS Sensor, which positions the light-receiving surface for optimal light reception. More light means clearer, blur-free images with plenty of detail and nuance, even in dark areas. Working together with the CMOS sensor to deliver the HS SYSTEM is Canon's advanced DIGIC 4 Image Processor, which actively reduces noise and delivers high speed image processing.

Canon’s HS System provides dramatically greater sensitivity than your average camera with identical or greater megapixel counts. 
Click here for a larger image THE HS MEGAPIXEL ADVANTAGE
There's more to megapixels. Canon's HS System provides dramatically greater sensitivity than your average camera with identical or greater megapixel counts. That means you don't need excessive megapixels to achieve spectacular images with minimal noise, and you get equally impressive results out of the 12.1 megapixel ELPH 300 HS.

MEMORABLE MOMENTS IN FULL HD
Experiencing the brilliance of HD video in a Canon PowerShot ELPH digital camera has never been easier. With the convenient dedicated movie button, you'll be able to instantly record everyday moments in high-definition detail at the push of a button. Record in Full 1080p HD with stereo sound, and pick up the optional HTC-100 HDMI cable for viewing your footage directly on your HDTV. 

You can also use the optical zoom while shooting video, so you can get in nice and close--plus, no need to worry about shaky footage thanks to dynamic image stabilization to keep your videos steady!

Capture video in Full 1080p HD resolution, and add an optional HDMI cable for enjoying directly on your HDTV. A POWERSHOT THAT KEEPS UP WITH THE ACTION
Sometimes, the action just won't stop for you. The PowerShot ELPH 300 HS comes equipped with a High-Speed Burst Mode that can capture eight frames per second. Just hold down the shutter button and catch rapid-fire action sequences--perfect for sporting events! 

You can also add a fun slow motion effect to your videos, using Super Slow Motion Movie. Super Slow Motion Movie will record your clips at a high speed, so that when you watch your videos, they'll play back in slow motion--a great feature for analyzing sports play-by-play, or just for creating fun visual effects.

ADVANCED SMART AUTO FOR STILLS AND VIDEOS THAT SHINE
The PowerShot ELPH 300 HS digital camera takes the quality of your still images and videos to a whole new level--automatically. The camera's advanced Smart AUTO system detects a wealth of information about the scene you're shooting, then automatically selects the optimal settings for you. Now with an expanded range of 32 shooting scenarios, the camera handles a wide variety of situations, freeing you up to concentrate on composing your shot and capturing the moment you're looking for. From portraits to landscapes to action scenes, the PowerShot ELPH 300 HS digital camera has you covered, whether you're shooting stills or videos.

Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 Functions Canon PowerShot ELPH Series Feature Comparison
 * Smart AUTO
   The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity.
 * P Program
   Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically.
 * Movie Digest Mode
   Records a video clip before capturing a still image and then combines one day's worth of clips into a video.
 * Portrait
   The camera sets a large aperture, focusing the subject and artistically blurring the background to make your subject pop.
 * Kids & Pets
   Reduced focusing time freezes fast-moving subjects, so you won't miss those special shots.
 * Smart Shutter
   The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame.
 * High-speed Burst
   The camera shoots continuously at a high speed of approx. 8.2fps while you hold down the shutter.
 * Best Image Selection
   The camera takes five photos in succession, and then chooses the best one out of the bunch.
 * Handheld Night Scene
   Suppresses image blur even without the help of a tripod.
 * Low Light
   For high quality image capture in an amazing range of dimly-lit situations.
 * Fisheye Effect
   Add a classic photo distortion without a fisheye lens.
 * Miniature Effect for Movies & Stills
   Emphasizes perspective for a miniature effect by blurring upper and bottom portions of videos and stills.
 * Toy Camera Effect
   Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect.
 * Creative Light Effect
   Transform background bright spots to stars, hearts, music motes and more.
 * Monochrome
   Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue.
 * Super Vivid
   Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors.
 * Poster Effect
   Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts.
 * Color Accent
   Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome.
 * Color Swap
   Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects.
 * Beach
   Get clear shots of people at a sunny beach without darkened faces.
 * Foliage
   Capture brilliant shots of autumn foliage, greenery and blossoms.
 * Snow
   Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint.
 * Fireworks
   Grab brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks.
 * Stitch Assist
   Build awe-inspiring panoramas by neatly aligning sequential images.

MOVIE CAPABILITIES
The PowerShot ELPH 300 HS gives you a variety of resolution options for shooting movies, depending on your needs. Shoot in Full HD (1920 x 1080) at 30 fps for up to 14 min. 34 sec. or 4GB per clip. Shoot in HD (1280 x 720) at 24 fps for up to 20 min. and 43 sec. or 4GB per clip. Shoot in VGA (640 x 480) at 30 fps for up to 43 min. and 43 sec. or 4GB per clip and QVGA (320 x 240 at 30 fps) for up to 1 hour 58 min. and 19 sec. or 4GB per clip.

Super Slow Motion Movie Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion. (Watch a video of Super Slow Motion Movie Mode at the top of the page, just below the product image.)

Miniature Movie Mode Miniature Movie Mode enhances perspective to make large scenes like cityscapes or landscapes appear to be in miniature proportions. (Watch a video of Miniature Movie Mode at the top of the page, just below the product image.)

EASILY TURN YOUR MEMORIES INTO VIDEOS
Putting together a video containing highlights from family vacations, important occasions and other special events is now easier than you might imagine. Using the Movie Digest Mode, you can have the camera automatically record a short video clip (up to approximately 4 seconds) every time you shoot a still image. The camera will then combine an entire day's worth of clips into a single video. No editing required--Movie Digest Mode does all the work, so you can sit back and enjoy your video!

ADD SOME FUN TO YOUR PHOTOS
Two new scene modes, Toy Camera Effect and Monochrome, add an artistic look to your photos.



Toy Camera Effect
Add some vintage nostalgia with Toy Camera Effect, which recreates the classic look by darkening the edges to make them appear as if they were photographed through a pinhole lens, and amping up the contrast.



Monochrome
Monochrome lets you stray from the usual black and white, letting you choose from three single-toned effects: Black & White, Sepia, or Blue, to really give your photos the effect you're looking for.
